metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2053 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The asn1_ber_decoder function in lib/asn1_decoder.c in the Linux kernelbefore 4.3 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (panic) via anASN.1 BER file that lacks a public key, leading to mishandling by thepublic_key_verify_signature function incrypto/asymmetric_keys/public_key.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.3.0-1.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.3.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.3.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-1.10').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-1006.6').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
